intro: Landolphia togolana, commonly known as the African star apple, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces woody, fleshy fruits that are edible and have a sweet, aromatic flavor. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Its rapid growth and ornamental value make it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation.
